body:
What if a non-IU ops member takes on external OASIS repo responsibilities?

In the unlikely event of a transfer of service, a transfer of responsibilities would be included. The receiving site would be responsible for updating the documentation.


What if all IU ops members are unavailable?

We are available 24x7x365 if needed, 317-278-9699 will connect you to the GRNOC. They have a call list to go through until they reach someone. This mechanism has been used (once or twice per year) and has always worked. (I am at the top of the list…) I believe we are the only subgroup of ops with this property but I may be mistaken.


Scott Teige PhD
Grid Operations Center Manager
Indiana University Research Technologies
steige@iu.edu<mailto:steige@iu.edu>
Office: +1 812 856 7331




On Nov 8, 2017, at 12:39 PM, Brian Lin <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> wrote:


In that case, "Operations" should be specific enough. What if a non-IU ops member takes on external OASIS repo responsibilities? What if all IU ops members are unavailable? Narrowing the scope to that extent seems unnecessary here.
